root_causes: Script references B4nDKx3 (the multi-question set) instead of the specific sub-variable B4nDKx3_5 specified in the expected logic.
miss(B4nDKx3) is not appropriate for validating a specific answer code variable (B4nDKx3_5); the script should validate the existence/value of the sub-variable representing answer code 5.
instructions: Use the sub-variable for answer code 5 (B4nDKx3_5) in the selection/validation instead of B4nDKx3. Example: sel if miss(B4nDKx3_5) or B4nDKx3_5 <> 1 (or sel if miss(B4nDKx3_5) or ~range(B4nDKx3_5,1,1)) depending on how selected is encoded.

If the data model stores multi-response as a set where any(B4nDKx3,5) is the correct check, make that explicit and do not use miss(B4nDKx3). For example: sel if miss(B4nDKx3_5) or ~any(B4nDKx3,5) OR (if B4nDKx3_5 exists) sel if miss(B4nDKx3_5) or B4nDKx3_5 <> 1. Ensure the variable name you check matches the expected Variable ID (B4nDKx3_5).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the generated script does not restrict checks to respondents who meet the entry condition (GreaterThan('B5ba',4).size() > 0).
Script only validates B5bb value range but does not enforce that B5bb should be present only when any B5ba sub-question > 4.
instructions: Add the entry-condition filter to the selection so validation runs only for respondents who had any B5ba item > 4. For example: temporary. sel if (B5ba_1 > 4 or B5ba_2 > 4 or B5ba_3 > 4) and (miss(B5bb) or ~range(B5bb,0,6)). list respid, B5bb.
If B5ba has more sub-variables or a different naming convention in data, replace B5ba_1..B5ba_3 with the actual B5ba variables used to determine GreaterThan('B5ba',4).

root_causes: Missing custom validation: the expected ValidationCode (CheckDK3D('B5cx1','B5cDKx1'); and conditional validateB1c("S7_1","B5cx1");) is not executed in the generated script.
Script only checks numeric bounds (v < 0 or v > 999) and does not run the DK/related-question checks or the additional validateB1c procedure described in the question attributes.
instructions: Execute the specified validation code before or as part of the SPSS checks. Concretely: call or translate CheckDK3D('B5cx1','B5cDKx1') and then, if no question errors and f('B5cDKx1').size() == 0, call validateB1c("S7_1","B5cx1"). Ensure these functions/macros are available in the SPSS environment or replace them with equivalent logic.

Keep the current numeric bounds check (sel if ~miss(v) and (v < 0 or v > 999)) but run it in combination with the DK checks. For example: temporary. /* run CheckDK3D */ /* run validateB1c if applicable */ sel if ~miss(v) and (v < 0 or v > 999) and (/* only for respondents passing DK checks */). list respid, v.

Ensure any special handling required for open-text numeric precision (Precision = 3) is respected if necessary (e.g. allow decimal values up to 3 decimal places) â€” but do not remove the required lower/upper bound checks.
